text: I have good news for all you spinach dip
lovers out there
this version is lighter and healthier
and it's made with ricotta you'll need a
pound of spinach or any Hardy
wintergreen just cut it into coarse
pieces and believe it or not all of this
spinach is gonna cook down to one cup
and go into this tiny little dish watch
and see there are a few different ways
you can go about collapsing your spinach
you can either steam it over simmering
water or you can do it in a big skillet
with a little oil that's the way I like
to do it so have a skillet over medium
medium-high heat add as much spinach as
you can to the pan so it looks like I
can get at least half of this in here
now a quick stir about just to coat the
spinach with that olive oil and do
yourself the favor of popping on a lid
that'll create steam and it'll collapse
much faster than if you just try to do
it with no lid and as soon as this
collapses down we can add in the rest of
the spinach you can see this is already
happening it's been all of what 30
seconds maybe and I think I can put the
rest of the spinach in now another quick
stir and hop on the lid okay let's take
a peek
exactly what we're looking for its
collapsed it's taken all that beautiful
deep green color transfer this to a
colander or a sieve set over a bowl and
let it drain until it's cool enough to
handle that'll take maybe ten or fifteen
minutes at the most our spinach is
collapsed and cooled down a bit
take your hands don't be afraid to get
in there and really give it a good
squeeze we want all of that excess
moisture out of the spinach and that
goes into the bowl look at that that was
a pound that massive bowl of spinach is
this a cup of ricotta goes in with it
I like a little Dijon I like that little
bit of heat and tang from the mustard
I'm just gonna do about a teaspoon I
think here
nutmeg freshly grated as always don't
even buy the pre ground nutmeg and if
you have it in your kitchen do yourself
a favor and throw it out and that smell
is just fantastic
salt to taste you do have salt in the
ricotta and of course in the mustard so
you don't need a whole lot here
and black pepper and this just gets
stirred about folding it all together
mmm look how pretty that is and this
just gets transferred to our little
baking dish we want every bit of that
cheese in there and this goes into a
preheated 425 degree oven for about 10
to 12 minutes until it's golden brown
and bubbly on top and hot all the way
through ah yes this is bubbly golden
brown and fragrant and ready to serve
hot with your favorite crostini or
crackers
